channel.title: [PI] Getting My Client Online [PI] PLEASE HELP!
channel.description:
Hey guys, I just finished coding and fixing my base(PI) and right now I'm trying to get it online.
Now, I have heard PI servers are easy to get online but...not for me, I'm a great coder but when it comes to putting this crap online, I fail.
Now, I understand that nothing has to be changed in the server side.(anything that had to be set in the server side is set, example:matched ports with Client side.)
So, In the Client side, In the Client.Java, the IP in their is set to my No-Ip. (Again, the ports are matched.)
Just to let you know, I have Portforwarded. What am I doing wrong?If you can please help me out, I WOULD GREATLY APPRECIATE IT!
If I do not respond to you immediately on these forums, add me on MSN Shadowbmx99@hotmail.com OR Shadowbmx99@yahoo.com
Again, I would GREATLY APPRECIATE the help. ;)
EDIT:So I see I have tons of views but no comments,(douche bags)
Reward for helping me:2M RS cash

item.title: [PI] Getting My Client Online [PI] PLEASE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @P_A_N_I_C P A N I C
item.description:
@P_A_N_I_C wrote:

You yourself can’t directly connect to your server IP other’s can but you must connect to: 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1

client.java
gui.java

to find server IP’s

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Getting My Client Online [PI] PLEASE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

No you don’t have to change anything on the server side.

There may be an antileech that is stopping you from doing that though so perhaps you need to look to see if there is an antileech lol.

item.title: [PI] Getting My Client Online [PI] PLEASE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

Alright, I have my NO-IP set on the client side, now on the server side, when I run it to put it online, it says running on 0.0.0.0: Port 43594.

Do I change the 0.0.0.0 or keep it?

Read full topic

item.source: [PI] Getting My Client Online [PI] PLEASE HELP!

item.title: [PI] Getting My Client Online [PI] PLEASE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Tension_Ltd Tension Ltd
item.description:
@Tension_Ltd wrote:

You have to put the ip on the client side to your no-ip, then upload the client to (mediafire or uppit or something like that). So when people download the link they can log on. After your done that, you have to switch the no-ip to (localhost or 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0) so you ca log in .

Hope I helped

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Getting My Client Online [PI] PLEASE HELP!

item.title: [PI] Getting My Client Online [PI] PLEASE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @DannyIsSoPro DannyIsSoPro
item.description:
@DannyIsSoPro wrote:

Wait,are you sure I put the Ip on the client side to localhost? cause then other people can’t connect,and yeah I have team viewer and i don’t have much cash in rs,
sorry if I can’t give you what you want.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Getting My Client Online [PI] PLEASE HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

You aren’t suppose to set your No-IP IP client sided, you won’t connect - Instead, change it to either 127.0.0.1, 0.0.0.0, or localhost - any of those will work.

Read full topic
